Package edu.baylor.flarn.ws

Class WsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.socket.handler.AbstractWebSocketHandler
      • org.springframework.web.socket.handler.TextWebSocketHandler
        • edu.baylor.flarn.ws.WsHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.web.socket.WebSocketHandler
    @Component
public class WsHandler
extends org.springframework.web.socket.handler.TextWebSocketHandler
    WsHandler class defines a handler for different WS operations. It handles the activities when user attempts a problem.

    Our server to client connections will be one to one, unlike typical chat applications. So we don't need to save the list of sessions. Instead we will always communicate to the client from which we have received a message. We only need to map the sessionId with wsSessionId.
